radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodule, 4 mm in diameter, with the density of metal overlying the fifth posterior rib; otherwise normal.
Multiple, small centrilobular nodules and small cysts, each less than 3 mm in diameter.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT scan showed persistent centrilobular ground-glass nodules and scattered, small parenchymal cysts.

radiographic_examinations.findings: New nodule, 4.5 mm in diameter, in the lower lobe of the left lung, with a rim of ground-glass opacification.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The clustered centrilobular cysts and ground-glass nodules were unchanged.
